actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title XVI of the Social Security Act to reduce from 21 to 18 the age at which a disabled child need no longer include his parents' income in determining his eligibility for supplemental security income benefits or the amount of such benefits.

summary.text: Reduces from 21 to 18 the age at which a disabled child need no longer include his parents' income in determining his eligibility for supplemental security income benefits, or the amount of such benefits, under title XVI of the Social Security Act.

titles.title: A bill to amend title XVI of the Social Security Act to reduce from 21 to 18 the age at which a disabled child need no longer include his parents' income in determining his eligibility for supplemental security income benefits or the amount of such benefits.
